item.title: Report X-2023080577
item.description:
Report X-2023080577

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN UNLOAD WITH A SOAKED TOP. THE TOP OF THE BOX WAS ALSO RIPPED FROM THE LEAKAGE. THE 5 LITER JUGS WERE TAKEN OUT OF THE SOILED BOX AND PLACED IN A LINED DRUM. DescribePack: THE PACKAGES FAILURE WAS IN THE CLOSURE. THE LID ON ONE OF THE 5 LITER JUGS WAS LOOSE WHICH CAUSED SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE JUGS WERE TAKEN OUT OF THE BOX AND PACED IN A LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report I-2023060149
item.description:
Report I-2023060149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: LAURENS
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver and technician were transferring drum from pallet onto trailer floor when it suddenly cracked, causing contents of drum to spill out. The liquid spilled onto concrete and trace amounts impacted storm drain. Generator responded immediately to mitigate spill and potential environmental cleanup. Pigs were placed around storm drain which prevented most of the liquid from entering storm drain which helped isolate further cleanup and liquid run off. Acid absorbent material and lime were used to soak up remaining liquid. The PPE and contents of cleanup were placed in over-pack drum and transported to TSDF as required. After inspection grounds it was determined no liquid was visibility detected in outfall nor did it impact round soil. Under the advisement from South Carolina Department of Health and Enviromental (SCDHEC) lime was dispensed into storm drain as added precaution. In addition, quarterly storm-water was recommended to assure no further contamination occurred.
